record.title: MEASURE PLACED ON THE CALENDAR--H.R. 1908
record.narrative:
MEASURE PLACED ON THE CALENDAR--H.R. 1908 -- (Senate - September 11, 2007)

[Page: S11355]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I understand H.R. 1908 is at the desk and due for a second reading.

record.chair: The leader is correct. The clerk will read the bill by title for the second time.
The assistant legislative clerk read as follows:
A bill (H.R. 1908) to amend title 35, United States Code, to provide for patent reform.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I now object to any further proceedings.

record.chair: Objection is heard. The bill will be placed on the calendar.
